extendedIngredients.name: fennel bulb
extendedIngredients.original: 1 fresh fennel bulb, trimmed, halved vertically, cored, sliced paper-thin
extendedIngredients.originalName: fresh fennel bulb, trimmed, halved vertically, cored, sliced paper-thin

extendedIngredients.name: fish
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/4 pounds thinly sliced smoked fish (such as sable, trout, or whitefish)
extendedIngredients.originalName: thinly sliced smoked fish (such as sable, trout, or whitefish)

title: Smoked Fish with Fennel and Arugula Salad
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Smoked Fish with Fennel and Arugula Salad a try. One portion of this dish contains roughly 15g of protein, 5g of fat, and a total of 110 calories. This recipe serves 8. For $1.51 per serving, this recipe covers 9% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. A mixture of baby arugula leaves, chives, fish, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. To use up the lemon juice you could follow this main course with the Lemon Shortbread Cookies with Lemon Icing {A Tribute to Aunt Roxanne} as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 73%. This score is good. Try Smoked Fish Platter with Mustard-Caper Sauce and Fennel-Cucumber Salad, Arugula-Fennel Salad, and Fennel-arugula Salad for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are my top picks for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Straw yellow hue, accompanied by a close-focused nose of pear, apricot and white flowers. The fruity palate, with top notes of stone fruit, shows ripeness and roundness well supported by an elegant acidity and savoriness, ensuring a long, lingering finish.

instructions: Preparation                                                        Overlap fish on one side of platter. Whisk oil and lemon juice in bowl. Season dressing with salt and pepper. Toss half with fennel and half with arugula. Mound both alongside fish. Sprinkle with chives.

steps.step: Overlap fish on one side of platter.
Whisk oil and lemon juice in bowl. Season dressing with salt and pepper. Toss half with fennel and half with arugula. Mound both alongside fish.
